content: The "Compact Impact Relief Act of 2016" may be cited as the Act. It includes an FMAP adjustment for affected jurisdictions equivalent to Compact Migrant expenditures. The "Compact Impact Relief Act of 2016" authorizes an FMAP increase for affected jurisdictions based on estimated Compact Migrant expenditures. The chief executive official of the affected jurisdiction must estimate compact migrant expenditures 90 days before the quarter, submitted to the Secretary of the Interior for review 60 days before the quarter. The Secretary of the Interior reviews and adjusts the estimated compact migrant expenditures submitted by the chief executive official before the quarter, and then submits the final amount to the Secretary of Health and Human Services. The Secretary of HHS estimates the necessary increase in FMAP for each affected jurisdiction. The Secretary of HHS estimates the increase in FMAP needed for each affected jurisdiction to match the final estimated compact migrant expenditures submitted. The Secretary of HHS estimates the increase in FMAP needed for each affected jurisdiction to match the final estimated compact migrant expenditures submitted under subsection (c) for the quarter, ensuring payments do not exceed limitations under title XIX of the Social Security Act. The Secretary of Health and Human Services notifies chief executive officials of affected jurisdictions about FMAP increases exceeding limitations under the Social Security Act. Payment adjustments are reconciled based on reports submitted by jurisdictions for each quarter. For each calendar quarter with an FMAP increase for an affected jurisdiction, the chief executive official must report total compact migrant expenditures to the Secretary of the Interior. The report must be submitted in a specified form. The Secretary of the Interior reviews and adjusts migrant expenditures reported by chief executive officials for accuracy before submitting a final accounting to the Secretary of Health and Human Services. The Secretary of Health and Human Services may make further adjustments as needed. The Secretary of Health and Human Services reviews and adjusts migrant expenditures reported by chief executive officials before submitting a final accounting to ensure accurate Federal payments under title XIX of the Social Security Act. The Secretary of Health and Human Services adjusts migrant expenditures reported by chief executive officials to ensure accurate Federal payments under title XIX of the Social Security Act, with appropriate adjustments made to the FMAP for future quarters. The Secretary of Health and Human Services adjusts migrant expenditures reported by chief executive officials to ensure accurate Federal payments under title XIX of the Social Security Act. This includes making appropriate adjustments to the FMAP for future quarters, subject to certain limitations, to account for any overpayment or underpayment resulting from the increase in FMAP. The FMAP for an affected jurisdiction cannot exceed 100 percent. The FMAP for an affected jurisdiction cannot exceed 100 percent, as per the Compact of Free Association Amendments Act of 2003. The term "affected jurisdiction" is defined in the Compact of Free Association Amendments Act of 2003. "Compact migrant expenditures" refer to non-Federal funds spent by an affected jurisdiction on services for qualified nonimmigrants. The term "affected jurisdiction" refers to the amount of non-Federal funds spent on services for qualified nonimmigrants as defined in the Compact of Free Association Amendments Act of 2003. This includes payments to healthcare providers for services provided to qualified nonimmigrants. The term "FMAP" refers to the Federal medical assistance percentage, as defined in the Social Security Act, without regard to this section. The Federal medical assistance percentage, as defined in the Social Security Act, is subject to section 2 of the Compact Impact Relief Act of 2016. SEC. 3. PAYMENTS FOR EDUCATION OF CITIZENS OF FREELY ASSOCIATED STATES. Amendments to the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 include educating alien children from Freely Associated States and payments for eligible federally connected children. Amendment to Section 8003(a) of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 includes adding eligibility for payments for children from the Republic of the Marshall Islands, the Federated States of Micronesia, or the Republic of Palau who reside in the United States. Amendment to Section 8003(a) of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 allows for payments for children from the Republic of the Marshall Islands, the Federated States of Micronesia, or the Republic of Palau residing in the United States. Additional funds are authorized for eligible federally connected children. Additional funds of $10,000,000 are authorized annually for eligible federally connected children under Section 8014 of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965. Preference for US citizens or nationals for housing financial assistance in Guam and the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands is amended to prioritize them over eligible aliens. SEC. 5. INDEPENDENT ASSESSMENT OF STRATEGIC IMPORTANCE OF RELATIONSHIP BETWEEN THE UNITED STATES AND THE MARSHALL ISLANDS, THE FEDERATED STATES OF MICRONESIA, AND PALAU. The Secretary of State will seek an agreement with an organization to assess the strategic importance of the US relationship with the Marshall Islands, Micronesia, and Palau, including their role in the Asia-Pacific re-balance and security. An assessment will be conducted on the relationships between the United States and the Republic of the Marshall Islands, the Federated States of Micronesia, and the Republic of Palau as part of the Asia-Pacific re-balance. Additionally, the capabilities and shortcomings of US Government agencies in administering the Compact of Free Association with these countries will be evaluated. The assessment will include recommendations on improving the administration of the Compacts of Free Association with the Marshall Islands, Micronesia, and Palau, as well as suggestions for the renewal and future administration of these agreements. Other relevant matters will also be addressed by the eligible organization. The eligible organization entering into an agreement under this section must submit a report to the Secretary of State within one year of the enactment of the Act. The report will include the assessment required under subsection (a), recommendations for improving the administration of Compacts of Free Association, and any other relevant matters deemed appropriate by the organization. The eligible organization must submit a report to the Secretary of State within one year of the Act's enactment. The report should include the required assessment, recommendations for improving Compacts of Free Association administration, and any other relevant matters as determined by the Secretary. The report must be in unclassified form, with the option of a classified annex if needed. The eligible organization entering an agreement can obtain official data from US departments or agencies to carry out the section. The head of the department or agency must provide the information upon request.
